how to placer an image in markdowon?
Sure, here's how you can add an image to Markdown.

**Using HTML**
If you want to insert a simple image using markdown, you will need to use html. Here is the basic structure:

```
![Alt text](/path/to/img.jpg)
```

Replace `img.jpg` with the name of your image file and `/path/to/img.jpg` with the path to your image.

**Using Markdown Syntax**
Most Markdown implementations support a syntax that lets you add captions and link an image's alt-text directly to its source. 

If your image is hosted somewhere on the web, such as on Imgur, GitHub, or another hosting platform, here’s how you’d do it:

```
![Image Description](https://imageurlhere.com)
```

Replace "Image Description" with a description of what's in your image.

**Using Local Images**
If you're creating a Markdown document that will be converted to HTML and the images are not being hosted elsewhere, but instead are stored locally on your computer or server:

```markdown
![Local Image](/path/to/img.jpg)
```

Replace `/path/to/img.jpg` with the path of your local image file.

Remember, always ensure you have permissions to use any images you're inserting into Markdown documents.
